meanings.definition: To make someone angry or irritated.
meanings.sent1: Her constant teasing madded her little brother.
meanings.sent2: The loud noise madded the dog next door.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous kitten madded the grumpy old cat by stealing its toy.
meanings.sent4: The never-ending traffic jam madded him like a buzzing mosquito in his ear.
meanings.sent5: The dripping faucet madded her to the point of madness.

meanings.sent1: She madded easily when things didn't go her way.
meanings.sent2: He madded at the rude customer's behavior.
meanings.sent3: The stubborn lock madded him by refusing to open.
meanings.sent4: The unanswered phone calls madded him like a persistent itch.
meanings.sent5: The constant interruptions madded her more than she could bear.
